1: [a]By the waters[b] of Babylon, there we sat down and wept, when we remembered Zion.
2: On the willows[c] there we hung up our lyres.
3: For there our captors required of us songs, and our tormentors, mirth, saying, “Sing us one of the songs of Zion!”
4: How shall we sing the Lord's song in a foreign land?
5: If I forget you, O Jerusalem, let my right hand wither!
6: Let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth, if I do not remember you, if I do not set Jerusalem above my highest joy!
7: Remember, O Lord, against the E′domites the day of Jerusalem, how they said, “Raze it, raze it! Down to its foundations!”
8: O daughter of Babylon, you devastator![d] Happy shall he be who requites you with what you have done to us!
9: Happy shall he be who takes your little ones and dashes them against the rock!
